net flux of CH4 from the land to the atmosphere (not including AFOLU and other anthropogenic emissions). A positive value indicates release of CH4 from the land, a negative value indicates a net land uptake.
warnings: Calculated as the sum of wetlands, permafrost and natural biomass burning. Oxidation of CH4 on land not included. CH4 emissions from anthropogenic biomass burning are in "Emissions|CH4|Other".

RCMIP name: Net Land to Atmosphere Flux|CH4|Earth System Feedbacks
longname: net flux of CH4 from the land to the atmosphere (not including AFOLU and other anthropogenic emissions) due to Earth System Feedbacks. A positive value indicates release of CH4 from the land, a negative value indicates a net land uptake.
warnings: Calculated as the sum of wetlands, permafrost and natural biomass burning. Oxidation of CH4 on land not included.

RCMIP name: Net Land to Atmosphere Flux|CH4|Earth System Feedbacks|Other
longname: net flux of CH4 from the land to the atmosphere (not including AFOLU and other anthropogenic emissions) due to non-permafrost feedbacks. A positive value indicates release of CH4 from the land, a negative value indicates a net land uptake.  Please specify in a comment on the comments sheet, which feedbacks are included here.
warnings: Calculated as the sum of wetlands and natural biomass burning. Oxidation of CH4 on land not included. CH4 emissions from anthropogenic biomass burning are in "Emissions|CH4|Other".

RCMIP name: Net Land to Atmosphere Flux|CH4|Earth System Feedbacks|Other|Wetlands
longname: net flux of CH4 from the land to the atmosphere (not including AFOLU and other anthropogenic emissions) due to wetlands feedbacks. A positive value indicates release of CH4 from the land, a negative value indicates a net land uptake.
warnings: Wetlands only

RCMIP name: Net Land to Atmosphere Flux|CH4|Earth System Feedbacks|Other|Natural Biomass Burning
longname: net flux of CH4 from the land to the atmosphere (not including AFOLU and other anthropogenic emissions) due to natural biomass burning feedbacks. A positive value indicates release of CH4 from the land, a negative value indicates a net land uptake.
warnings: Natural biomass burning only. CH4 emissions from anthropogenic biomass burning are in "Emissions|CH4|Other".

RCMIP name: Net Land to Atmosphere Flux|CH4|Earth System Feedbacks|Permafrost
longname: net flux of CH4 from the land to the atmosphere (not including AFOLU and other anthropogenic emissions) due to the permafrost feedback. A positive value indicates release of CH4 from the land, a negative value indicates a net land uptake.
warnings: Permafrost only

longname: net flux of CO2 from the land to the atmosphere (not including AFOLU and other anthropogenic emissions). A positive value indicates release of CO2 from the land, a negative value indicates a net land uptake.
warnings: Calculated as the sum of permafrost and land sink

RCMIP name: Net Land to Atmosphere Flux|CO2|Earth System Feedbacks
longname: net flux of CO2 from the land to the atmosphere (not including AFOLU and other anthropogenic emissions) due to Earth System Feedbacks. A positive value indicates release of CO2 from the land, a negative value indicates a net land uptake.
warnings: Calculated as the sum of permafrost and land sink

RCMIP name: Net Land to Atmosphere Flux|CO2|Earth System Feedbacks|Other
longname: net flux of CO2 from the land to the atmosphere (not including AFOLU and other anthropogenic emissions) due to non-permafrost feedbacks. A positive value indicates release of CO2 from the land, a negative value indicates a net land uptake.  Please specify in a comment on the comments sheet, which feedbacks are included here.
warnings: Land carbon sink only

RCMIP name: Net Land to Atmosphere Flux|CO2|Earth System Feedbacks|Permafrost
longname: net flux of CO2 from the land to the atmosphere (not including AFOLU and other anthropogenic emissions) due to the permafrost feedback. A positive value indicates release of CO2 from the land, a negative value indicates a net land uptake.
warnings: Permafrost only

longname: net flux of CH4 from the ocean to the atmosphere (not including anthropogenic emissions). A positive value indicates release of CH4 from the ocean, a negative value indicates a net ocean uptake.
warnings: Oxidation of CH4 on ocean not included (not a flux into ocean). 0.

longname: cumulative net flux of CO2 from the ocean to the atmosphere (not including anthropogenic emissions). A positive value indicates release of CO2 from the ocean, a negative value indicates a net ocean uptake.
warnings: Ocean carbon sink

RCMIP name: Cumulative Net Land to Atmosphere Flux|CH4
longname: cumulative net flux of CH4 from the land to the atmosphere (not including AFOLU and other anthropogenic emissions). A positive value indicates release of CH4 from the land, a negative value indicates a net land uptake.
warnings: Calculated as the sum of cumulated wetlands, permafrost and natural biomass burning. Oxidation of CH4 on land not included.

RCMIP name: Cumulative Net Land to Atmosphere Flux|CH4|Earth System Feedbacks
longname: cumulative net flux of CH4 from the land to the atmosphere (not including AFOLU and other anthropogenic emissions) due to Earth System Feedbacks. A positive value indicates release of CH4 from the land, a negative value indicates a net land uptake.
warnings: Calculated as the sum of cumulated wetlands, permafrost and natural biomass burning. Oxidation of CH4 on land not included.

RCMIP name: Cumulative Net Land to Atmosphere Flux|CH4|Earth System Feedbacks|Other
longname: cumulative net flux of CH4 from the land to the atmosphere (not including AFOLU and other anthropogenic emissions) due to non-permafrost feedbacks. A positive value indicates release of CH4 from the land, a negative value indicates a net land uptake.  Please specify in a comment on the comments sheet, which feedbacks are included here.
warnings: Calculated as the sum of cumulated wetlands and natural biomass burning. Oxidation of CH4 on land not included.

RCMIP name: Cumulative Net Land to Atmosphere Flux|CH4|Earth System Feedbacks|Other|Wetlands
longname: cumulative net flux of CH4 from the land to the atmosphere (not including AFOLU and other anthropogenic emissions) due to wetlands feedbacks. A positive value indicates release of CH4 from the land, a negative value indicates a net land uptake.
warnings: Wetlands only

RCMIP name: Cumulative Net Land to Atmosphere Flux|CH4|Earth System Feedbacks|Other|Natural Biomass Burning
longname: cumulative net flux of CH4 from the land to the atmosphere (not including AFOLU and other anthropogenic emissions) due to natural biomass burning feedbacks. A positive value indicates release of CH4 from the land, a negative value indicates a net land uptake.
warnings: Natural biomass burning only

RCMIP name: Cumulative Net Land to Atmosphere Flux|CH4|Earth System Feedbacks|Permafrost
longname: cumulative net flux of CH4 from the land to the atmosphere (not including AFOLU and other anthropogenic emissions) due to the permafrost feedback. A positive value indicates release of CH4 from the land, a negative value indicates a net land uptake.
warnings: Permafrost only

RCMIP name: Cumulative Net Land to Atmosphere Flux|CO2
longname: cumulative net flux of CO2 from the land to the atmosphere (not including AFOLU and other anthropogenic emissions). A positive value indicates release of CO2 from the land, a negative value indicates a net land uptake.
warnings: Calculated as the sum of cumulated permafrost and land sink

RCMIP name: Cumulative Net Land to Atmosphere Flux|CO2|Earth System Feedbacks
longname: cumulative net flux of CO2 from the land to the atmosphere (not including AFOLU and other anthropogenic emissions) due to Earth System Feedbacks. A positive value indicates release of CO2 from the land, a negative value indicates a net land uptake.
warnings: Calculated as the sum of cumulated permafrost and land sink

RCMIP name: Cumulative Net Land to Atmosphere Flux|CO2|Earth System Feedbacks|Other
longname: cumulative net flux of CO2 from the land to the atmosphere (not including AFOLU and other anthropogenic emissions) due to non-permafrost feedbacks. A positive value indicates release of CO2 from the land, a negative value indicates a net land uptake.  Please specify in a comment on the comments sheet, which feedbacks are included here.
warnings: Land carbon sink only

RCMIP name: Cumulative Net Land to Atmosphere Flux|CO2|Earth System Feedbacks|Permafrost
longname: cumulative net flux of CO2 from the land to the atmosphere (not including AFOLU and other anthropogenic emissions) due to the permafrost feedback. A positive value indicates release of CO2 from the land, a negative value indicates a net land uptake.
warnings: Permafrost only

RCMIP name: Cumulative Net Ocean to Atmosphere Flux|CH4
longname: cumulative net flux of CH4 from the ocean to the atmosphere (not including anthropogenic emissions). A positive value indicates release of CH4 from the ocean, a negative value indicates a net ocean uptake.
warnings: Oxidation of CH4 on ocean not included (not a flux into ocean). 0.

RCMIP name: Cumulative Net Ocean to Atmosphere Flux|CO2
longname: cumulative net flux of CO2 from the ocean to the atmosphere (not including anthropogenic emissions). A positive value indicates release of CO2 from the ocean, a negative value indicates a net ocean uptake.
warnings: Cumulated Ocean carbon sink

longname: global total net primary productivity
total carbon dioxide emissions captured and stored

total carbon dioxide emissions captured and stored in geological deposits (e.g. in depleted oil and gas fields, unmined coal seams, saline aquifers) and the deep ocean, stored amounts should be reported as positive numbers

total carbon dioxide emissions captured from bioenergy use and stored in geological deposits (e.g. in depleted oil and gas fields, unmined coal seams, saline aquifers) and the deep ocean, stored amounts should be reported as positive numbers

total carbon dioxide emissions captured from fossil fuel use and stored in geological deposits (e.g. in depleted oil and gas fields, unmined coal seams, saline aquifers) and the deep ocean, stored amounts should be reported as positive numbers
total carbon dioxide sequestered through direct air capture
total carbon dioxide sequestered through enhanced weathering
total carbon dioxide sequestered in feedstocks (e.g., lubricants, asphalt, plastics)
total carbon dioxide sequestered through land-based sinks (e.g., afforestation, soil carbon enhancement, biochar)
total carbon dioxide sequestered through afforestation
total carbon dioxide sequestered through biochar
total carbon dioxide sequestered through other land-based mitigation techniques
total carbon dioxide sequestered through soil carbon management techniques
total carbon dioxide sequestered through other techniques (please provide a definition of other sources in this category in the 'comments' tab)
fraction of (cumulative) emitted CO2 which is still in the atmosphere
warnings: Calculated as the sum of CO2 emissions from FFI, LUC and permafrost, minus land sink and ocean sink, cumulated over time, divided by the sum of CO2 emissions from FFI and LUC, cumulated over time.

longname: effective climate sensitivity over time, here defined as ECS_eff(t) = \Delta T(t) * RF2x / (RF(t) - dH/dt) where ECS_eff is effective climate sensitivity, \Delta T(t) is Surface Air Temperature Change, RF2x is radiative forcing due to a doubling of atmospheric CO2 concentrations, RF(t) is radiative forcing and dH/dt is the energy imbalance at the top of the atmosphere (likely equal to ocean heat uptake in most of our reduced complexity models)

effective climate feedback over time, here defined as \lambda_eff(t) = (RF(t) - dH/dt) / \Delta T(t) where \lambda_eff is effective climate feedback, \Delta T(t) is Surface Air Temperature Change, RF(t) is radiative forcing and dH/dt is the energy imbalance at the top of the atmosphere (likely equal to ocean heat uptake in most of our reduced complexity models)
total Heat Uptake of the Earth System (ZJ is zetta joules i.e. 10^21J), equivalent to the the energy imbalance at the top of the atmosphere.
ice Heat Uptake  (ZJ is zetta joules i.e. 10^21J)
land Heat Uptake (ZJ is zetta joules i.e. 10^21J)
ocean Heat Uptake through surface layer of the ocean (ZJ is zetta joules i.e. 10^21J)
other Heat Uptake (ZJ is zetta joules i.e. 10^21J). Please specify what "other" is in the Comments sheet.
total ocean heat content
ocean heat content between 0 and 700m
ocean heat content between 700 and 2000m
warming per unit cumulative CO2 (this should simply be your 'Surface Air Temperature Change' divided by 'Cumulative Emissions|CO2')
warnings: Calculated as Delta_T / cumulated emissions of CO2

RCMIP name: Surface Air Ocean Blended Temperature Change
longname: change in blended surface air/ocean tempertaure (i.e. quantity which is directly comparable with observational datasets e.g. HadCRUT4 or best proxy thereof). Please note reference period in comment sheet.
change in surface air tempertaure (i.e. 2m air temperature or best proxy thereof). Please note reference period in comment sheet.
warnings: Reference period defined at the preindustrial: 1850

longname: change in surface layer ocean tempertaure. Please note reference period in comment sheet.
warnings: Reference period defined at the preindustrial: 1850

longname: total black carbon emissions
warnings: Sum of BC emissions from AFOLU, FFI, anthropogenic AND natural biomass burning.

longname: black carbon emissions from agriculture, forestry and other land use (IPCC category 3), excluding any fossil-fuel based emissions in the Agricultural sector (hence not identical to WG3 AFOLU)
black carbon emissions from energy use on supply and demand side (IPCC category 1A, 1B), industrial processes (IPCC category 2), waste (IPCC category 4) and other (IPCC category 5)
black carbon emissions from other sources (please provide a definition of other sources in this category in the 'comments' tab)
warnings: BC emissions from anthropogenic AND natural biomass burning.

longname: total methane emissions
warnings: Sum of CH4 emissions AFOLU, FFI and anthropogenic biomass burning. Natural biomass burning of CH4 is in the category "Net Land to Atmosphere Flux|CH4|Earth System Feedbacks|Other|Natural Biomass Burning".

longname: methane emissions from agriculture, forestry and other land use (IPCC category 3), excluding any fossil-fuel based emissions in the Agricultural sector (hence not identical to WG3 AFOLU)
methane emissions from energy use on supply and demand side (IPCC category 1A, 1B), industrial processes (IPCC category 2), waste (IPCC category 4) and other (IPCC category 5)
methane emissions from other sources (please provide a definition of other sources in this category in the 'comments' tab)
warnings: CH4 emissions from anthropogenic biomass burning. Natural biomass burning of CH4 is in the category "Net Land to Atmosphere Flux|CH4|Earth System Feedbacks|Other|Natural Biomass Burning".

longname: total carbon monoxide emissions
warnings: Sum of CO emissions from AFOLU, FFI, anthropogenic AND natural biomass burning.

longname: carbon monoxide emissions from agriculture, forestry and other land use (IPCC category 3), excluding any fossil-fuel based emissions in the Agricultural sector (hence not identical to WG3 AFOLU)

carbon monoxide emissions from other sources (please provide a definition of other sources in this category in the 'comments' tab)
warnings: CO emissions from anthropogenic AND natural biomass burning.

longname: total carbon dioxide emissions
warnings: Only anthropogenic emissions here, no permafrost. CO2 emissions from LUC used here are those calculated by OSCAR.

warnings: Emissions calculated by OSCAR, not MAGICC, using its book-keeping module.
